Package org.eclipse.imagen.media.jiffle.parser

Class SymbolScope

Object
SymbolScope
Direct Known Subclasses:
GlobalScope, LocalScope
public abstract class SymbolScope extends Object
A symbol scope level.

Adapted from "Language Implementation Patterns" by Terence Parr, published by The Pragmatic Bookshelf, 2010.

Author:
michael

    Method
    Description
    void
    add(Symbol symbol)
    Adds a symbol to this scope.
    void
    add(Symbol symbol, boolean allowReplacement)
    Adds a symbol to this scope, optionally allowing replacement of any existing symbol with the same name.

    get(String name)
    Searches for a symbol in this scope and, if not found, any enclosing scopes.

    Returns name of all symbols with the given type, in the current scope and enclosing scopes

    Searches for a symbol in this scope and, if not found, any enclosing scopes.

    • SymbolScope

      public SymbolScope(String name, SymbolScope enclosingScope)
      Creates a new instance.
      Parameters:
      name - label for this scope
      parent - scope or null if top level

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Gets the name of this scope instance.

    • getEnclosingScope

      public SymbolScope getEnclosingScope()
      Gets the parent scope or null if this is the top scope.

    • add

      public void add(Symbol symbol)
      Adds a symbol to this scope. If a symbol with the same name is already defined, an exception is thrown.

    • add

      public void add(Symbol symbol, boolean allowReplacement)
      Adds a symbol to this scope, optionally allowing replacement of any existing symbol with the same name.

    • has

      public boolean has(String name)
      Tests if a symbol is defined in this scope or any enclosing scope.

    • get

      public Symbol get(String name)
      Searches for a symbol in this scope and, if not found, any enclosing scopes.
      Returns:
      the symbol
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the symbol is not found

    • getDeclaringScope

      public SymbolScope getDeclaringScope(String name)
      Searches for a symbol in this scope and, if not found, any enclosing scopes.
      Returns:
      the symbol
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the symbol is not found

      Returns name of all symbols with the given type, in the current scope and enclosing scopes
